page.title: 02Todwick Church.
page.content:
{St Peter's & St Paul's Church,Todwick}
Todwick church is made of sandstone. It has a big graveyard with trees surrounding it.The tower is about 80 feet high.At the front of the choir stalls there is an{eagle lectern. There are 17th century{Jacobean box pews.The arch inside the church was replaced with stone from Roche Abbey which is a Benedictine Monastery in ruins near Maltby.There is a sundial hanging above the door.The church has metal scaffolding round the tower because it isn't safe.They are replacing some stones with stone from York.The{emblem}of the church is the {sword}and{key}because of St Peter and St Paul.This Church of England church is the only church in Todwick. The Rector is shortly to leave to go to Dore in Sheffield.
